lead_paragraph: Gauti Eggertsson writes in to follow up on my piece on quantitative easing in the Great Depression. He points me to a 2008 paper (pdf) in which he shows that the coming of FDR, combined with America's exit from the gold standard, was seen by markets as a huge regime change; it was, said FDR's own budget director, "the end of Western civilization."
snippet: The end of the world as we knew it, and we felt fine.
abstract: The end of the world as we knew it, and we felt fine.
